comments.body: Need to mention preserve only worked from local to remove from 2.3, 2.6+ would work with remote_src True
Fixed via a note in the remote_src description (which lists other remote_src limitations)

@@ -1,1 +67,71 @@        up with a decimal number which will have unexpected results.  As of version 1.8, the mode
        may be specified as a symbolic mode (for example, C(u+rwx) or C(u=rw,g=r,o=r)).  As of
        version 2.3, the mode may also be the special string C(preserve).  C(preserve) means that
        the file will be given the same permissions as the source file."
  directory_mode:

comments.body: There is an extra /a/ in this sample path.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +176,180 @@    src: /etc/foo.conf
    dest: /path/to/link # /path/to/link is link to /path/to/file
    follow: False
'''

comments.body:
this is too aggressive as it removes all ACLs, not just the ones we added

take into account that directories can have 'default acl' to be added to all new files in a directory, this would wipe those along with the one we added to copy the file into place

There are no default ACLs at that point as they are overridden by `shutil.copystat`. Which leaves us with irrelevant ACLs so clearing all of them makes sense.

See explaining comments including the FIXME note about default ACLs I added in the last commit. I am very open to suggestions as I don't have better ideas.
hmm, need to x2 check but it used to keep default ACLs ... or is this a PY2 vs PY3 issue?
